channel.title: Science : NPR
channel.description: The latest health and science news. Updates on medicine, healthy living, nutrition, drugs, diet, and advances in science and technology. Subscribe to the Health & Science podcast.

channel.itunes:summary: The latest health and science news. Updates on medicine, healthy living, nutrition, drugs, diet, and advances in science and technology. Subscribe to the Health & Science podcast. http://www.npr.org/sections/science/

item.title: There Are More Than 60,000 Tree Species Worldwide, Scientists Say
item.description: April 12, 2017 - More than half of those species are only found in a single country, and many of them face extinction. The scientists hope that this database will be an important tool for conservationists.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 12, 2017 - More than half of those species are only found in a single country, and many of them face extinction. The scientists hope that this database will be an important tool for conservationists. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/04/12/523616033/there-are-60-000-species-of-tree-worldwide-scientists-say

item.title: No Ant Left Behind: Warrior Ants Carry Injured Comrades Home
item.description: April 12, 2017 - Don't call it empathy, scientists say. These termite-eating ants only retrieve injured comrades on the way home from a hunt, not before. But the hurt ants do recover better at home — to fight again.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 12, 2017 - Don't call it empathy, scientists say. These termite-eating ants only retrieve injured comrades on the way home from a hunt, not before. But the hurt ants do recover better at home — to fight again. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/04/12/523313734/no-ant-left-behind-warrior-ants-carry-injured-comrades-home

item.title: A Forgotten Piece Of African-American History On The Great Plains
item.description: April 12, 2017 - Nearly a century ago, Dearfield, Colo., was a thriving African-American farm community, admired by many of its white neighbors. There were even early signs of integration. Then came the Dust Bowl.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 12, 2017 - Nearly a century ago, Dearfield, Colo., was a thriving African-American farm community, admired by many of its white neighbors. There were even early signs of integration. Then came the Dust Bowl. http://www.npr.org/sections/thesalt/2017/04/12/521800847/a-forgotten-piece-of-african-american-history-on-the-great-plains

item.title: Fungal Pesticides Offer A Growing Alternative To Traditional Chemicals
item.description: April 12, 2017 - The rise of organic produce has sparked a new interest in using biopesticides like fungi to kill insects, instead of traditional synthetic ones. But they are still just a tiny segment of the market.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 12, 2017 - The rise of organic produce has sparked a new interest in using biopesticides like fungi to kill insects, instead of traditional synthetic ones. But they are still just a tiny segment of the market. http://www.npr.org/sections/thesalt/2017/04/12/522068205/fungal-pesticides-offer-a-growing-alternative-to-traditional-chemicals

item.title: How To Get Low-Income Students Into Selective Colleges
item.description:
April 12, 2017 - New social science research looks at how to get more low-income students into college.
- http://www.npr.org/2017/04/12/523534103/how-to-get-low-income-students-into-selective-colleges
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 12, 2017 - New social science research looks at how to get more low-income students into college. http://www.npr.org/2017/04/12/523534103/how-to-get-low-income-students-into-selective-colleges

item.title: Cash-Strapped State Environmental Agencies Brace For Budget Cuts
item.description: April 11, 2017 - Proposed budget cuts to the Environmental Protection Agency could leave state environmental agencies doing more with less money. But many say they are already strapped.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 11, 2017 - Proposed budget cuts to the Environmental Protection Agency could leave state environmental agencies doing more with less money. But many say they are already strapped. http://www.npr.org/2017/04/11/523450904/cash-strapped-state-environmental-agencies-brace-for-budget-cuts

item.title: Top Scientists Revamp Standards To Foster Integrity In Research
item.description: April 11, 2017 - The National Academy of Sciences has toughened up its guidelines to call cutting corners, dubious statistics and not fully sharing research methods "detrimental" to science.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 11, 2017 - The National Academy of Sciences has toughened up its guidelines to call cutting corners, dubious statistics and not fully sharing research methods "detrimental" to science. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/04/11/523406710/top-scientists-revamp-standards-to-foster-integrity-in-research

item.title: Asbestos Deaths Remain A Public Health Concern, CDC Finds
item.description: April 11, 2017 - Exposure to the tiny fibers in asbestos can lead people who work around the material to develop mesothelioma, a cancer of the thin membranes that line the chest and abdomen.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 11, 2017 - Exposure to the tiny fibers in asbestos can lead people who work around the material to develop mesothelioma, a cancer of the thin membranes that line the chest and abdomen. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/04/11/523277735/asbestos-deaths-remain-a-public-health-concern-cdc-finds

item.title: Spinal Manipulation Can Alleviate Back Pain, Study Concludes
item.description: April 11, 2017 - Physically manipulating the spine appears to offer a modestly effective alternative to medication for lower back pain, according to a new evaluation of scientific studies.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 11, 2017 - Physically manipulating the spine appears to offer a modestly effective alternative to medication for lower back pain, according to a new evaluation of scientific studies. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/04/11/523388406/spinal-manipulation-can-alleviate-back-pain-study-concludes

item.title: Federal Task Force Softens Opposition To Routine Prostate Cancer Screening
item.description: April 11, 2017 - The U.S. Preventive Services Task Force proposes each man decide with his doctor whether to undergo routine PSA testing, citing recent evidence of benefits and ways to minimize downsides of screening.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 11, 2017 - The U.S. Preventive Services Task Force proposes each man decide with his doctor whether to undergo routine PSA testing, citing recent evidence of benefits and ways to minimize downsides of screening. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/04/11/522912221/federal-task-force-softens-opposition-to-routine-prostate-cancer-screening

item.title: A 'Hot Zone' In The Brain May Reveal When, And Even What, We Dream
item.description: April 10, 2017 - When people have dreams, an area near the back of the brain seems to wake up. And specific patterns of brain activity in that area can even reveal what we're dreaming about.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 10, 2017 - When people have dreams, an area near the back of the brain seems to wake up. And specific patterns of brain activity in that area can even reveal what we're dreaming about. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/04/10/523262108/a-hot-zone-in-the-brain-may-reveal-when-and-even-what-we-dream

item.title: Natural Gas Plant Makes A Play For Coal's Market, Using 'Clean' Technology
item.description: April 10, 2017 - The idea behind "clean coal" is technology that would capture for reuse most of the carbon dioxide emitted by coal-burning power plants. Entrepreneurs aim to use similar tech to clean natural gas.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 10, 2017 - The idea behind "clean coal" is technology that would capture for reuse most of the carbon dioxide emitted by coal-burning power plants. Entrepreneurs aim to use similar tech to clean natural gas. http://www.npr.org/2017/04/07/522662776/natural-gas-plant-makes-a-play-for-coals-market-using-clean-technology

item.title: Great Barrier Reef Hit By Bleaching For The Second Year In A Row
item.description: April 10, 2017 - Scientists say severe bleaching events have happened three other times in the past 20 years — but never in consecutive years. They fear that prolonged stress could kill the corals.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 10, 2017 - Scientists say severe bleaching events have happened three other times in the past 20 years — but never in consecutive years. They fear that prolonged stress could kill the corals. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/04/10/523254085/great-barrier-reef-hit-by-bleaching-for-the-second-year-in-a-row

item.title: Drugs That Work In Mice Often Fail When Tried In People
item.description: April 10, 2017 - Most potential new drugs don't work when tested in people. It's a major disappointment and it drives up the cost of developing new drugs. One big reason is the use of animals in medical research.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 10, 2017 - Most potential new drugs don't work when tested in people. It's a major disappointment and it drives up the cost of developing new drugs. One big reason is the use of animals in medical research. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/04/10/522775456/drugs-that-work-in-mice-often-fail-when-tried-in-people

item.title: A Mountain Lion Kitten Is Found, Leading To Excitement And Concern
item.description: April 9, 2017 - A mountain lion kitten was found in the Santa Monica Mountains, just outside Los Angeles. Biologists are excited to see new kittens being born but are concerned about inbreeding.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 9, 2017 - A mountain lion kitten was found in the Santa Monica Mountains, just outside Los Angeles. Biologists are excited to see new kittens being born but are concerned about inbreeding. http://www.npr.org/2017/04/09/523163935/a-mountain-lion-kitten-is-found-leading-to-excitement-and-concern
